@description.name: @description
@description.body: This class emulates the built-in JavaScript String class. It can be used as base class for classes, which need to derive from String. Instances of this class can be used in any place a JavaScript string can.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: txt {String?""} Initialize with this string
@param.description: Initialize with this string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the specified character from a string. Characters in a string are indexed from left to right. The index of the first character is 0, and the index of the last character in a string called stringName is stringName.length - 1. If the index you supply is out of range, JavaScript returns an empty string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
index {Integer} An integer between 0 and 1 less than the length
   of the string.
@param.description:
An integer between 0 and 1 less than the length
   of the string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a number indicating the Unicode value of the character at the given index.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
index {Integer} An integer greater than 0 and less than the length
   of the string; if it is not a number, it defaults to 0.
@param.description:
An integer greater than 0 and less than the length
   of the string; if it is not a number, it defaults to 0.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Combines the text of two or more strings and returns a new string. Changes to the text in one string do not affect the other string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: stringN {String} One or more strings to be combined.
@param.description: One or more strings to be combined.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index within the calling String object of the first occurrence of the specified value, starting the search at fromIndex, returns -1 if the value is not found.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {String} A string representing the value to search for.
@param.description: A string representing the value to search for.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
offset {Integer?0} The location within the calling string to start
   the search from. It can be any integer between 0 and the length of the
   string. The default value is 0.
@param.description:
The location within the calling string to start
   the search from. It can be any integer between 0 and the length of the
   string. The default value is 0.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the index within the calling String object of the last occurrence of the specified value, or -1 if not found. The calling string is searched backward, starting at fromIndex.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: index {String} A string representing the value to search for.
@param.description: A string representing the value to search for.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
offset {Integer?0} The location within the calling string to start
   the search from, indexed from left to right. It can be any integer
   between 0 and the length of the string. The default value is the length
    of the string.
@param.description:
The location within the calling string to start
   the search from, indexed from left to right. It can be any integer
   between 0 and the length of the string. The default value is the length
    of the string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Used to retrieve the matches when matching a string against a regular expression. If the regular expression does not include the g flag, returns the same result as regexp.exec(string). If the regular expression includes the g flag, the method returns an Array containing all matches.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
regexp {Object} A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object
  obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using
   new RegExp(obj).
@param.description:
A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object
  obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using
   new RegExp(obj).

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Object} The matching RegExp object or an array containing all
   matches.
@return.description:
The matching RegExp object or an array containing all
   matches.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Finds a match between a regular expression and a string, and replaces the matched substring with a new substring.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
regexp {Object} A RegExp object. The match is replaced by the
   return value of parameter #2. Or a String that is to be replaced by
   newSubStr.
@param.description:
A RegExp object. The match is replaced by the
   return value of parameter #2. Or a String that is to be replaced by
   newSubStr.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
aFunction {Function} A function to be invoked to create the new
   substring (to put in place of the substring received from parameter
   #1).
@param.description:
A function to be invoked to create the new
   substring (to put in place of the substring received from parameter
   #1).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Executes the search for a match between a regular expression and this String object. If successful, search returns the index of the regular expression inside the string. Otherwise, it returns -1.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
regexp {Object} A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object
  obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using
   new RegExp(obj).
@param.description:
A regular expression object. If a non-RegExp object
  obj is passed, it is implicitly converted to a RegExp by using
   new RegExp(obj).

@return.name: @return
@return.body:
{Object} The matching RegExp object or -1.
   matches.
@return.description:
The matching RegExp object or -1.
   matches.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Extracts a section of a string and returns a new string. Slice extracts the text from one string and returns a new string. Changes to the text in one string do not affect the other string. As a negative index, endSlice indicates an offset from the end of the string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
beginslice {Integer} The zero-based index at which to begin
   extraction.
@param.description:
The zero-based index at which to begin
   extraction.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
endSlice {Integer?null} The zero-based index at which to end
   extraction. If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string.
@param.description:
The zero-based index at which to end
   extraction. If omitted, slice extracts to the end of the string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Splits a String object into an array of strings by separating the string into substrings. When found, separator is removed from the string and the substrings are returned in an array. If separator is omitted, the array contains one element consisting of the entire string. If separator is a regular expression that contains capturing parentheses, then each time separator is matched the results (including any undefined results) of the capturing parentheses are spliced into the output array. However, not all browsers support this capability. Note: When the string is empty, split returns an array containing one

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
separator {String?null} Specifies the character to use for
   separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular
   expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one
   element consisting of the entire string.
@param.description:
Specifies the character to use for
   separating the string. The separator is treated as a string or a regular
   expression. If separator is omitted, the array returned contains one
   element consisting of the entire string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
limit {Integer?null} Integer specifying a limit on the number of
   splits to be found.
@param.description:
Integer specifying a limit on the number of
   splits to be found.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the characters in a string beginning at the specified location through the specified number of characters. Start is a character index. The index of the first character is 0, and the index of the last character is 1 less than the length of the string. substr begins extracting characters at start and collects length characters (unless it reaches the end of the string first, in which case it will return fewer). If start is positive and is greater than or equal to the length of the string, substr returns an empty string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
start {Integer} Location at which to begin extracting characters
   (an integer between 0 and one less than the length of the string).
@param.description:
Location at which to begin extracting characters
   (an integer between 0 and one less than the length of the string).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: length {Integer?null} The number of characters to extract.
@param.description: The number of characters to extract.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a subset of a String object. substring extracts characters from indexA up to but not including indexB. In particular: If indexA equals indexB, substring returns an empty string. If indexB is omitted, substring extracts characters to the end of the string. If either argument is less than 0 or is NaN, it is treated as if it were 0. If either argument is greater than stringName.length, it is treated as if it were stringName.length. If indexA is larger than indexB, then the effect of substring is as if the two arguments were swapped; for example, str.substring(1, 0) == str.substring(0, 1).

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
indexA {Integer} An integer between 0 and one less than the
   length of the string.
@param.description:
An integer between 0 and one less than the
   length of the string.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
indexB {Integer?null} (optional) An integer between 0 and the
   length of the string.
@param.description:
(optional) An integer between 0 and the
   length of the string.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the calling string value converted to lowercase. The toLowerCase method returns the value of the string converted to lowercase. toLowerCase does not affect the value of the string itself.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the calling string value converted to uppercase. The toUpperCase method returns the value of the string converted to uppercase. toUpperCase does not affect the value of the string itself.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} unique hash code of the object
@return.description: unique hash code of the object

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The characters within a string are converted to lower case while respecting the current locale. The toLowerCase method returns the value of the string converted to lowercase. toLowerCase does not affect the value of the string itself.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The characters within a string are converted to upper case while respecting the current locale. The toUpperCase method returns the value of the string converted to uppercase. toUpperCase does not affect the value of the string itself.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Call the same method of the super class.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: args {arguments} the arguments variable of the calling method
@param.description: the arguments variable of the calling method

@param.name: @param
@param.body: varags {var} variable number of arguments passed to the overwritten function
@param.description: variable number of arguments passed to the overwritten function

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {var} the return value of the method of the base class.
@return.description: the return value of the method of the base class.
